intro: Anabasis iliensis, commonly known as the Ili sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia, particularly found in Kazakhstan and western China. It is a low-growing perennial herb that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, and its leaves are typically fleshy and adapted to reduce water loss. Anabasis iliensis is part of the Amaranthaceae family and is known for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an important species in its native habitat.
